title: @Riot If there's ever gonna be a VGU in the future...

Well I would have thought Urgot or Yorick would have happened before Shen or Fiora, so I don't really put too much faith in their prioritization.

I don't have much faith in VGU's in general.

Yorick was being worked on during both Fiora and Shen (or...at least work was just beginning around Fiora).

Urgot is.....a difficult character. No one knows what he is really meant to be. Trying to come up with something entirely new for him is really difficult.

While I do agree that the Shen VGU is surprising, Fiora, on the other hand, was quite possibly the most toxic champ ever to be released in League of Legends (with the possible exception of Kalista or reworked Morde). Despite being quite new to the roster, she desperately needed a heavy rework, and the Visual update only came about due to her needing new animations.
Urgot is supposed to be a cyborg.
More like undead monstrosity brought back to life thanks to SCIENCE!

Fiora was the most toxic champion ever according to Riot 0:  
She was listed as being either a toxic mess of uncounterplay, or an absolute suicidal liability to her team.

If they started after Fiora, that's still getting the order wrong, because the one that didn't get picked was a champ that they thought was so bad they wouldn't put him on the free rotation.

Think about that. Fiora is the most toxic champ ever? Did you ever play against the old Yorick? Even if he was so weak as to be useless from level one, he was so bad to lane against that they refused to let people try him for free.

Fiora had nothing on him. 

And who cares if Urgot is difficult, that's what they get payed for. They won't figure it out until after they start, so may as well start sooner than later if he's as bad as they and everyone else says.

He'll probably end up being a support.

So instead of going with an idea they had, they should of sat there for a few months until they came up with an idea that might of worked, but most likely would feel forced?

What?
